primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The invasion of a hostage-held territory by the Creator to liberate humanity from cosmic Powers through a substitutionary ransom.

tekstueel_bewijs: The Son of Man came... to give his life
God is personally involving himself in the rescue
He has... substituted himself for us
set free from its bondage to decay
effectively delivering us from the malevolent Powers

zender.identificatie: God the Father / The Divine Nature
tekstueel_bewijs: He who did not spare his own Son

ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer is explicitly positioned as the helpless Receiver/Hostage.

helper.identificatie: Scripture / The Holy Spirit (implied as 'Living Word')
tekstueel_bewijs: Word of God as our guide
Only from Scripture... do we learn these things
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject, not merely a Helper.
helper.rol_van_geest: External help through the Word to provide 'Savoir-faire'.

tegenstander.identificatie: Cosmic Powers: Sin, Evil, Death, The Devil
tekstueel_bewijs: malevolent Powers that would destroy humanity
territory held largely by the Devil
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is ontological and structural, rendering human effort (Subjectivity) impossible.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The 'Underground Resistance': The liberated community participating in God's ongoing struggle.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer / 'Foot soldiers'
secundair_narratief_programma.object: Liberty and human flourishing / Small deeds of love
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program is strictly contingent on the completion of the primary ('The big stuff has already been done').

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.subject_naar_object: Son of Man → Ransom of the Many

voorbeelden_god_subject: The Son of Man came not to be served but to serve
He has established himself for ever over the dark Powers
voorbeelden_mens_subject: You are being called into Christ's army

voorbeelden: It must be rooted and grounded in Scripture
if you hunger and thirst after righteousness
Only in Scripture does the meaning... come clear
a Power strong enough to conquer Sin and Death
upholding the universe by his word of power

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'Power' of God to act where humans are 'impotent' (hostages).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Bondage) to S1 (Grace) via the 'Invasion' of the Subject.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Substitution: The Subject (S1) enters the space of S2 to pay the ransom.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; Sin and Death are treated as objective occupying forces.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is a textbook example of theocentric narrative. God is the primary actor; humans are beneficiaries of an action they could not perform.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God is personally involving himself in the rescue.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Joan of Arc is used as a 'foil' (contrast) rather than an example to follow for salvation.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon explicitly rejects 'Be like Joan' in favor of 'Christ did what Joan couldn't'.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from Soteriology (The Ransom) to Ethics (The Resistance) is perfectly maintained.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: The invasion has begun... securing the beachheads... conquering Sin and Death.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit is not mentioned by name, but the 'Living Word' functions as the agent of competence.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Total bondage; 'hostages locked in a building'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The narrative engine is entirely driven by God's agency. The hearer is moved from a state of 'incompetence' to 'participation' based solely on the Subject's performance.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; appropriate for Holy Week.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon masterfully avoids the trap of moralism by maintaining God as the Subject of the primary verbs of salvation.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'invasion' metaphor's effectiveness; semiotics shows the metaphor is necessary because the human Subject is actantially 'dead'.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the word 'ransom'; semiotics explains why the hearer cannot be the one paying it.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'Resistance' (Ethics) is only possible because the 'Heavy Artillery' (Soteriology) changed the hearer's modal competence from 'Non-Pouvoir' to 'Pouvoir'.

appendices.notnotes: The sermon uses the 'Aslan' and 'D-Day' metaphors to reinforce the Christus Victor actantial model.
